content: Who wrote the classic novel 'Pride and Prejudice', which tells the story of Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England?

The classic novel 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen. Published in 1813, it is one of her most famous works and remains widely read and admired for its wit, social commentary, and memorable characters. The story revolves around Elizabeth Bennet and her journey through issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry during the early 19th century in England.
